intro: Montanoa atriplicifolia, commonly known as Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are palmately lobed, resembling those of the plantain, and are often covered in fine hairs. Montanoa atriplicifolia produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators.
